title: 15+ Best Scandinavian Fonts (Nordic, Norse & Rune)
description: Give your designs a nordic touch using the best Scandinavian fonts listed in this post. They bring a tribe, winter, nature, forest, Viking, vibe to designs.
author: Jacob Cass
excerpt: Give your designs a nordic touch using the best Scandinavian fonts listed in this post. They bring a tribe, winter, nature, forest, Viking, vibe to designs.
text: Are you looking for the best Scandinavian fonts to bring a Nordic touch to your designs? The following list of the best Scandinavian fonts will be helpful for you. When designing something unique and attractive, using typography with strong and elegant letterforms will take your artwork to new heights. This is what Scandinavian fonts are used for. Their cultural vibe with stunning letter forms offers a whole new Nordic feel to the design. Scandinavian fonts are inspired by the Scandinavian movement that happened in the early 20th century in Denmark, Iceland, Finland, Sweden, and Norway. They look beautiful and include practical design elements to suit different designs. Whether you want to design clothing designs, banners, signs, logos, or titles for your site, Scandinavian fonts are the perfect option. They bring both classic beauty and functionality to help capture attention. They are capable of making your designs  eye-catching and stand out. Here we have a collection of 15 best Scandinavian fonts that you can try to give your designs a Nordic feel. 15+ Best Scandinavian Fonts for a Nordic Feel Hand Drawn Flower Display Font Bjorn Font Noatun Font Nordica Font Zenzero Grotesk Typeface Castle Font Dont Worry Hand Drawn Font Old North August Boy Bold Dingbat Brush Font Tiny Joy Font Nordic Tale Folkart Font Family Scandinavian Font Family Nordic Christmas Majolica Font Family Spring Dreams Typeface BEST SCANDINAVIAN FONTS – UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets Download all the Scandinavian Fonts you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)! 15+ Best Nordic Fonts (Scandinavian, Rune, Norse) 1. Hand Drawn Flower Display Font Image Credits- Envato Elements The Flower is a hand-drawn Scandinavian display font available in TTF, OTF, and WOFF file formats. This font has unique letterforms with flourish spring flowers, monoline hearts, and swirls inserts. We love how it adds an elegant cultural vibe to your handmade designs, making it perfect to update any project with a fresh look. In our opinion, this font is suitable for wedding cards, greeting cards, albums, logos, gift shops, social media posts, Nordic tags, etc. Additionally, the regular version comes with a summer ornament for enhanced looks. 2. Bjorn Font Image Credits- Envato Elements Bjorn is a versatile sans-serif display font that has clean lines and sharp corners making it ideal for creating a strong visual impact. We think this font is great for large as well as small-sized designs. The font file includes multilingual characters, numbers, and punctuation.  Furthermore, Bjorn comes in three styles – regular, light, and halftone. It is perfect for logos, posters, titles, retro designs, clothing designs, sports-related designs, etc. 3. Noatun Font Image Credits- Envato Elements Noatun stands out as a distinctive sans-serif typeface that comes in a geometric style. We found that it has uppercase letters, numbers, punctuation, and multilingual support, enabling you to create excellent artwork with this font.  Additionally, it is available in two different versions that are suitable for logos, titles, short quotes, posters, and other design projects.  4. Nordica Font Image Credits- Envato Elements Nordica is a handmade blackletter font designed in a runic style. It looks beautiful and adds a Nordic touch to designs. In our opinion, this font is perfect for designers who want to read well at any size while maintaining that distinctive Nordic feel. This font package contains uppercase letters, numbers, and basic punctuation. Nordica comes in TTF and OTF file formats. We recommend using this font for posters, logos, apparel designs, greeting cards, etc. 5. Zenzero Grotesk Typeface Image Credits- Envato Elements Combining slab and sans serif styles, Zenzero Grotesk is a stylish and eccentric display font. This font is highly versatile and can be used for a wide range of projects such as logo designs, vintage artwork, branding projects, paragraphs or text writing, etc. With lots of ligatures and stylistic alternates, we think this font gives many possibilities to let you design anything you want. Moreover, it is available in two styles – regular and round, and both of them have web font versions. 6. Castle Font Image Credits- Envato Elements Castle is a handwritten script font available in regular, italic, bold, and bold italic versions. It’s hard to stop and not admire its versatility across projects, from children’s album titles, greeting cards, comics, antique subjects, Pinterest, gift shops, etc. Castle font is available in TTF and OTF file formats. It is also compatible with photoshop, illustrator, Microsoft word, InDesign, and your browser of choice. 7. Dont Worry Hand Drawn Font Image Credits- Envato Elements Dont Worry is a hand-drawn Nordic typeface that can be used to add a cultural touch to your designs. It has a floral design and ornaments for a beautiful look. This hand-drawn font is ideal for a wide range of designs, such as gift shops, greeting cards, logo designs, social media posts, etc. 8. Old North Image Credits- Envato Elements Old North is a rune-style font inspired by Norse runes. It has standard Latin characters and is an excellent option for giving a Scandinavian look to your designs. This font includes uppercase and lowercase letters and stylistic alternates to let you design your projects as you visioned. 9. August Boy Bold Dingbat Brush Font Image Credits- Envato Elements August Boy is a bold brush font that adds a handwritten touch to the artwork. It comes with 62 bonus shapes that help you design creative projects with ease. This font is suitable for cute cards, kids’ quotes, crafting designs, and other designs. The font package includes uppercase & lowercase letters, numbers, punctuations, international characters, and ligatures to let you work on a variety of projects. 10. Tiny Joy Font Image Credits- Design Cuts Tiny Joy is a childish Scandinavian typeface perfect for fun projects. It is available in OTF, TTF, and WOFF file formats. The font file includes uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, special characters, and accents. It is great for projects related to children. Also, the tiny joy font has stylistic alternates, which you can access in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, and Inkscape. 11. Nordic Tale Folkart Font Family Image Credits- Design Cuts Nordic Tale is a beautiful font designed with Nordic patterns to represent Scandinavian aesthetics. This is a Folkart font family, and its letters have unique cultural vibes. Nordic Tale is available in regular, decorative, and symbol versions and can be used in different design projects without an additional program. It is suitable for photo overlays, tourist brochures, book covers, article titles, posters, logos, etc. It is available in TTF and OTF file format and has multi-language support. 12. Scandinavian Font Family Image Credits- Creative Market Scandinavian is a unique font family inspired by Scandinavian designs. It adds a Nordic and traditional feel to designs. This font is available in three styles – decorative, black, and symbols. Scandinavian decorative and black versions include two sets of uppercase letters to help you create unique artwork. Therefore, you can combine these styles to create various designs. It also has multiple language support. All styles of this font are available in OTF, WOFF, and WOFF2 file formats. 13. Nordic Christmas Image Credits- Creative Market Nordic Christmas is a stylish Scandinavian font with a bold look and holiday feel. It is very easy to use without any additional software. There are two sets of alternatives available with this font that lets you try styles for your design. Inspired by Scandinavian motives, Nordic Christmas is an excellent option for greeting cards and poster designs. It has multi-language support and is available in TTF, OTF, WOFF, and WOFF2 file formats. The font file also includes numbers and a set of punctuation. 14. Majolica Font Family Image Credits- Creative Market Majolica is a new font inspired by Italian ceramics and floral patterns on square tiles. This font is available in three styles, namely decorative, inline, and symbol. You can mix & match these styles to create your designs. It is suitable for wedding designs, invitations, packaging, social media, photo overlays, printing clothes, and more. 15. King Castle Image Credits- Creative Market King Castle is an elegant Celtic-style font inspired by timeless traditions and modern chic. Its unique design makes it perfect for letterheads, titles, stationery, and more. This font is available in OTF, TTF, and WOFF file formats, ensuring compatibility across various platforms. It includes uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, accents, and special characters. Ideal for logos, decorative designs, wedding invitations, and crafts, King Castle adds a regal touch of historical charm and sophistication to your projects. Related Posts Best Viking Fonts Best Tribal Fonts Best Boho Fonts Best Winter Fonts Best Christmas Fonts Best Kids Fonts Best Fun Fonts for Graphic Designs 15+ Best Scandinavian Fonts to Give Your Designs a Nordic Feel Fonts are gaining significance as graphic design projects demand more ways to be expressive. Different fonts and typefaces help convey messages that aren’t outrightly said. These best Scandinavian fonts have stood the test of time and are excellent for any designer who needs fonts with creative and geometric characters. Scandinavian fonts have a feel of tribe, nature, winter, Nordic, Viking, and forest to let you represent your designs in a distinctive way. These fonts offer both style and security in their versatility – they stand the time test while bringing fresh appeal to modern designs. For more information about implementing these fonts in your projects, head home to our design resources section. If you found any of our fonts to your liking, share them with us in the comments below!
html:
Are you looking for the best Scandinavian fonts to bring a Nordic touch to your designs?

The following list of the best Scandinavian fonts will be helpful for you.

When designing something unique and attractive, using typography with strong and elegant letterforms will take your artwork to new heights. This is what Scandinavian fonts are used for. Their cultural vibe with stunning letter forms offers a whole new Nordic feel to the design.

Scandinavian fonts are inspired by the Scandinavian movement that happened in the early 20th century in Denmark, Iceland, Finland, Sweden, and Norway. They look beautiful and include practical design elements to suit different designs.

Whether you want to design clothing designs, banners, signs, logos, or titles for your site, Scandinavian fonts are the perfect option. They bring both classic beauty and functionality to help capture attention. They are capable of making your designs  eye-catching and stand out. Here we have a collection of 15 best Scandinavian fonts that you can try to give your designs a Nordic feel.

15+ Best Scandinavian Fonts for a Nordic Feel

  1. Hand Drawn Flower Display Font
  2. Bjorn Font
  3. Noatun Font
  4. Nordica Font
  5. Zenzero Grotesk Typeface
  6. Castle Font
  7. Dont Worry Hand Drawn Font
  8. Old North
  9. August Boy Bold Dingbat Brush Font
  10. Tiny Joy Font
  11. Nordic Tale Folkart Font Family
  12. Scandinavian Font Family
  13. Nordic Christmas
  14. Majolica Font Family
  15. Spring Dreams Typeface

BEST SCANDINAVIAN FONTS – UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets

Download all the Scandinavian Fonts you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)!

15+ Best Nordic Fonts (Scandinavian, Rune, Norse)

1. Hand Drawn Flower Display Font

The Flower is a hand-drawn Scandinavian display font available in TTF, OTF, and WOFF file formats. This font has unique letterforms with flourish spring flowers, monoline hearts, and swirls inserts. We love how it adds an elegant cultural vibe to your handmade designs, making it perfect to update any project with a fresh look.

In our opinion, this font is suitable for wedding cards, greeting cards, albums, logos, gift shops, social media posts, Nordic tags, etc. Additionally, the regular version comes with a summer ornament for enhanced looks.

2. Bjorn Font

Bjorn is a versatile sans-serif display font that has clean lines and sharp corners making it ideal for creating a strong visual impact. We think this font is great for large as well as small-sized designs. The font file includes multilingual characters, numbers, and punctuation. 

Furthermore, Bjorn comes in three styles – regular, light, and halftone. It is perfect for logos, posters, titles, retro designs, clothing designs, sports-related designs, etc.

3. Noatun Font

Noatun stands out as a distinctive sans-serif typeface that comes in a geometric style. We found that it has uppercase letters, numbers, punctuation, and multilingual support, enabling you to create excellent artwork with this font. 

Additionally, it is available in two different versions that are suitable for logos, titles, short quotes, posters, and other design projects. 

4. Nordica Font

Nordica is a handmade blackletter font designed in a runic style. It looks beautiful and adds a Nordic touch to designs. In our opinion, this font is perfect for designers who want to read well at any size while maintaining that distinctive Nordic feel.

This font package contains uppercase letters, numbers, and basic punctuation. Nordica comes in TTF and OTF file formats. We recommend using this font for posters, logos, apparel designs, greeting cards, etc.

5. Zenzero Grotesk Typeface

Combining slab and sans serif styles, Zenzero Grotesk is a stylish and eccentric display font. This font is highly versatile and can be used for a wide range of projects such as logo designs, vintage artwork, branding projects, paragraphs or text writing, etc.

With lots of ligatures and stylistic alternates, we think this font gives many possibilities to let you design anything you want. Moreover, it is available in two styles – regular and round, and both of them have web font versions.

6. Castle Font

Castle is a handwritten script font available in regular, italic, bold, and bold italic versions. It’s hard to stop and not admire its versatility across projects, from children’s album titles, greeting cards, comics, antique subjects, Pinterest, gift shops, etc. Castle font is available in TTF and OTF file formats. It is also compatible with photoshop, illustrator, Microsoft word, InDesign, and your browser of choice.

7. Dont Worry Hand Drawn Font

Dont Worry is a hand-drawn Nordic typeface that can be used to add a cultural touch to your designs. It has a floral design and ornaments for a beautiful look. This hand-drawn font is ideal for a wide range of designs, such as gift shops, greeting cards, logo designs, social media posts, etc.

8. Old North

Old North is a rune-style font inspired by Norse runes. It has standard Latin characters and is an excellent option for giving a Scandinavian look to your designs. This font includes uppercase and lowercase letters and stylistic alternates to let you design your projects as you visioned.

9. August Boy Bold Dingbat Brush Font

August Boy is a bold brush font that adds a handwritten touch to the artwork. It comes with 62 bonus shapes that help you design creative projects with ease. This font is suitable for cute cards, kids’ quotes, crafting designs, and other designs.

The font package includes uppercase & lowercase letters, numbers, punctuations, international characters, and ligatures to let you work on a variety of projects.

10. Tiny Joy Font

Tiny Joy is a childish Scandinavian typeface perfect for fun projects. It is available in OTF, TTF, and WOFF file formats. The font file includes uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, special characters, and accents.

It is great for projects related to children. Also, the tiny joy font has stylistic alternates, which you can access in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, and Inkscape.

11. Nordic Tale Folkart Font Family

Nordic Tale is a beautiful font designed with Nordic patterns to represent Scandinavian aesthetics. This is a Folkart font family, and its letters have unique cultural vibes. Nordic Tale is available in regular, decorative, and symbol versions and can be used in different design projects without an additional program.

It is suitable for photo overlays, tourist brochures, book covers, article titles, posters, logos, etc. It is available in TTF and OTF file format and has multi-language support.

12. Scandinavian Font Family

Scandinavian is a unique font family inspired by Scandinavian designs. It adds a Nordic and traditional feel to designs. This font is available in three styles – decorative, black, and symbols. Scandinavian decorative and black versions include two sets of uppercase letters to help you create unique artwork.

Therefore, you can combine these styles to create various designs. It also has multiple language support. All styles of this font are available in OTF, WOFF, and WOFF2 file formats.

13. Nordic Christmas

Nordic Christmas is a stylish Scandinavian font with a bold look and holiday feel. It is very easy to use without any additional software. There are two sets of alternatives available with this font that lets you try styles for your design.

Inspired by Scandinavian motives, Nordic Christmas is an excellent option for greeting cards and poster designs. It has multi-language support and is available in TTF, OTF, WOFF, and WOFF2 file formats. The font file also includes numbers and a set of punctuation.

14. Majolica Font Family

Majolica is a new font inspired by Italian ceramics and floral patterns on square tiles. This font is available in three styles, namely decorative, inline, and symbol. You can mix & match these styles to create your designs. It is suitable for wedding designs, invitations, packaging, social media, photo overlays, printing clothes, and more.

15. King Castle

King Castle is an elegant Celtic-style font inspired by timeless traditions and modern chic. Its unique design makes it perfect for letterheads, titles, stationery, and more.

This font is available in OTF, TTF, and WOFF file formats, ensuring compatibility across various platforms. It includes uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, accents, and special characters.

Ideal for logos, decorative designs, wedding invitations, and crafts, King Castle adds a regal touch of historical charm and sophistication to your projects.

15+ Best Scandinavian Fonts to Give Your Designs a Nordic Feel

Fonts are gaining significance as graphic design projects demand more ways to be expressive. Different fonts and typefaces help convey messages that aren’t outrightly said.

These best Scandinavian fonts have stood the test of time and are excellent for any designer who needs fonts with creative and geometric characters. Scandinavian fonts have a feel of tribe, nature, winter, Nordic, Viking, and forest to let you represent your designs in a distinctive way.

These fonts offer both style and security in their versatility – they stand the time test while bringing fresh appeal to modern designs. For more information about implementing these fonts in your projects, head home to our design resources section.

If you found any of our fonts to your liking, share them with us in the comments below!
